column1: Issued by the Natural Hazards Early Warning Centre
Issued at 11:00 a.m. 13 May 2023, valid for 11:00 a.m. 14 May 2023

column3: For Multi-day boats in the Bay of Bengal Sea area.

column2: ery severe cyclonic storm “Mocha” over East-Central Bay of Bengal has intensified into an

column1: extremely severe cyclonic storm and lay centered near 15.4N and 89.1E at 05.30 hours today
(13th May). It is very likely to move north-northeastwards and cross southeast Bangladesh and
north Myanmar coasts around noon of 14th May.

column3: Expected path of the cyclone (Source: RSMC-India)

column1: Due to this system, wind speeds will be (55-65) kmph and can increase up to (75-85) kmph in sea areas
bounded by (05N - 15N) and (82E – 87E) and wind speeds will be (115-125) kmph and can increase up to
145 kmph in sea areas bounded by (10N - 20N) and (87E – 100E) during next 24 hours.
